variables.description: The transition time for the dialogs to enter or leave.

context.name: react-md-dialogs

variables.description:
The distance that the dialog should move downwards when entering
and leaving.

context.name: react-md-dialogs

variables.description:
The z-index to use for full page dialogs. This should be the biggest z-index
in the application.

context.name: react-md-dialogs

variables.description: A dialog can not be less than this distance from the top / and bottom of the page.

context.name: react-md-dialogs

variables.description: A dialog can not be less than this distance from the left / right of the page.

context.name: react-md-dialogs
react-md-dialogs

usedBy.description:
Includes every component, transition, and typography including their
media queries if the `$md-media-included` variable is `true`. You can
modify any global variables before including this mixin to change the overall
theme.

context.name: react-md-everything

mixins.description:
This includes the styles for the footer in dialogs. It also creates an additional
button class name for buttons in dialogs. This is generally used in the `md-react-md-dialogs`
mixin.

context.name: react-md-dialogs-footer
react-md-dialogs

mixins.description: A simple mixin to set the width for a dialog.

parameter.name: units
parameter.description:
The number of units for the dialog's width to be.
    this will be multiplied by `56px` since it is a single unit on a dialog.

context.name: react-md-dialogs
